availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hawkins Brown (Surgeon of the First Kentucky Cavalry)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, physician. Lincoln County native. Son of Ellis Brown and Beatrice Carter Brown. Graduate of the University of Louisville Medical Department in 1854. Physician in Hustonville, Kentucky, in 1860. Assistant surgeon and surgeon in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from August 24, 1862, to December 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Lincoln County, Kentucky (Lincoln County Ky: Turner Publishing Company, 2002), 52.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 2-3.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Hustonville, p. 117.
Find A Grave, "Dr Hawkins Brown (November 12, 1832-December 1, 1903)," Memorial #81201842, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81201842 (accessed October 10, 2018).
